result.execSummary:
All charges against Jonathan Dean Stedt in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan Dean Stedt is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Dean Stedt

records.addlTxt: Per EFV on 6/23/22- dismiss 22CF282 and 22CF323.  gll

11:02 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Katie J Bosworth,  Atty Erdman appeared via zoom, DF: Jonathan Dean Stedt appeared from jail.  Includes 20CF375, 20CF935, 21CF106, 21CF193, 21CF300, 21CF415, 21CF453, 21CF456, 21CF619, 21CF797, 21CF877, 22CF282 PTC, and 22CF323 PTC. Atty Bosworth  recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 2: Battery w/ Enhancer- 947.01(1) and Count 4: Bail Jumping Felony- 946.49(1)(b) in case 21CF456 and Guilty to Count 2: Possession w/ Intent- THC- <= 200 Grams)- 964.41(1m)(h)1 in case 20CF375. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 20CF375 Counts 1, 3-6, 20CF935, 21CF106, 21CF193, 21CF300, 21CF415, 21CF453, 21CF456 Counts 3, 5-10, 21CF619, 21CF797, 21CF877, and dismiss and read-in 21CF456 Count 1. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

20CF375 Count 2: W/S 4 Years Probation. Cuncurrent

- 180 days condition time - Upon written verification of admittance into inpatient treatment. DE is to be released. Consecutive to 21CF456 Count 2 and 21CF456 Count 4
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample 
- AODA assessment within 30 days- Unless had AODA within 6 months of 06/06/22 has been completed
- DV assessment within 30 days
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Participate in MRT- If requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- No Contact with Destiny H.
- Obtain GED or HSED
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation as soon as possible

- Eligible to apply for St.Croix County treatment Court as ATR.

03:04 PM   Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  ADA:   Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Michelle M Erdman   DF:  Jonathan Dean Stedt appeared from jail.  INCLUDES: Preliminary hearings for 22CF282 & 22CF323.   DF wishes to waive the preliminary hearings in both cases.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF282 & 22CF323

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
